text: Hippolyte Simon (25 February 1944 â€“ 25 August 2020) was a French Roman Catholic archbishop. He was Bishop of Clermont from 1996 to 2002 before becoming Archbishop, serving until 2016. He was Vice-President of the Bishops' Conference of France from 2007 to 2013. He was born in Saint-Georges-de- Rouelley, France. Simon died on 25 August 2020 in Caen, France at the age of 76. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French Roman Catholic archbishops
